title: Illmatic
description: At 19 Nas made one of the most influential hip hop records of all time

title: Physical Graffiti
description: Zeppelin establishes themselves as one of the top bands

title: To Pimp a Butterfly
description: Kendrick Lamar's genre bending treatise on race and mental health

title: Enter the Wu-Tang: 36 chambers
description: Wu-Tang defines what would become the sound of NYC hip-hop

title: American Recordings
description: Johnny Cash explodes onto the music scene and instantly becomes an American icon

title: Yoshimi Battles the Pink Robots
description: The Flaming Lips made a bizarrely captivating record that runs all over the place

title: Chronic 2001
description: Dr. Dre reminds people why he was one of the best to ever make hip-hop music

title: Dark Side of the Moon
description: Pink Floyd's psychedelic masterpiece, often imitated and never replicated

title: Come on Over
description: Really? I know nothing about country music but this kept coming up in top country albums lists. I had no idea Shania Twain was a big deal in country music.

title: My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy
description: Kanye's maximilist magnum opus stands out as a grand exercise in both opulence and regret
